docs.lead_paragraph: Access to drugs to fight H.I.V. and AIDS in developing countries has improved recently, but new infections still vastly outpace treatment efforts, health officials said Monday. Three years ago, fewer than 300,000 people in the developing world were receiving antiretroviral drugs; last year, 2.2 million people did, Dr. Anthony Fauci, director of the United States National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, said at an AIDS conference in Sydney. “However, for every one person that you put in therapy, six new people get infected,” he said.
docs.snippet: Access to drugs to fight H.I.V. and AIDS in developing countries has improved recently, but new infections still vastly outpace treatment efforts, health officials said Monday. Three years ago, fewer than 300,000 people in the developing world were...

docs.lead_paragraph: New York would become the first state requiring all addiction treatment programs to help their clients quit smoking under a rule proposed yesterday.

headline.main: Smoking Ban Is Proposed in Drug Centers
headline.print_headline: Smoking Ban Is Proposed In Drug Centers

docs.lead_paragraph: The fewer nurses there are on duty in an intensive care unit, the more people on respirators get pneumonia, a new study has found.

headline.main: Hazards: Lower Nurse-to-Patient Ratio Is Linked to Pneumonia Risk
headline.print_headline: Lower Nurse-to-Patient Ratio Is Linked to Pneumonia Risk

docs.lead_paragraph: A new study suggests that the cells of people with many moles may age more slowly than those of people with fewer moles.

headline.main: Aging: Having Moles May Mean Younger Skin Cells

docs.lead_paragraph: A review of more than 700 studies has concluded that the herb has a substantial effect in preventing colds and in limiting their duration.

headline.main: Echinacea Helps Colds, Major Review Shows

docs.lead_paragraph: House Democrats have drafted a plan that calls for major changes in Medicare and promises to intensify the battle with the White House over health care.

headline.main: Democrats Press House to Expand Health Care Bill
headline.sub: In Growing Senate Plan, Veto Is Courted on Aid for Old and Young ;
